Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.control.screenController

Class ScoreBoardPopUpController

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.control.screenController.ScoreBoardPopUpController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ScoreBoardPopUpController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
ScoreBoardPopUpController class to register and handle event of the ScoreBoardPopUp.
Author:
Ziqi Yang

    void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
    When the score board pop up view is initialized from fxml file, GameEngine calls DataManger to read record from file and show them to player.
    If the player break any record of the current level, input area is initialize to ask player's name to record;
    Otherwise, options are provided for user to restart/ go to next level or go back to start screen.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      When the score board pop up view is initialized from fxml file, GameEngine calls DataManger to read record from file and show them to player.
      If the player break any record of the current level, input area is initialize to ask player's name to record;
      Otherwise, options are provided for user to restart/ go to next level or go back to start screen.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - URL representing a Uniform Resource Locator of fxml file.
      resources - Resource bundles contain locale-specific objects of fxml file.

    • showPlayerScore

      private void showPlayerScore()
      Generate messages to inform user the history record and user's record.

    • getRecordOfCurrentLevel

      private void getRecordOfCurrentLevel()
      Gets the high-score record from DataManager of the current level.
      See Also:
      DataManager.getTopRecord()

    • canUpdateRecord

      private boolean canUpdateRecord()
      Checks if the user breaks any record and show corresponding message to inform user.
      Returns:
      If any record is broken, true is returned to inform user to input name; Otherwise, false is returned.

    • enableInputArea

      private void enableInputArea()
      Enables the input area to ask for user's name if any record is broken.
      Input valid check is used here by calling isValidName() method.
      Once user input the name successfully, button area is initialized to provide user more options to restart/ go to next level or go back to start screen.
      See Also:
      isValidName(String), enableButtonArea(), Node.setVisible(boolean)

    • enableButtonArea

      private void enableButtonArea()
      Enables button area to provide user more options to restart/ go to next level or go back to start screen.
      See Also:
      Node.setVisible(boolean)

    • isValidName

      private boolean isValidName​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Check if the user input is valid.
      Parameters:
      playerName - String value specifying the name of user.
      Returns:
      True is returned if the input is from 1-16 word char; Otherwise, false is returned.

    • popOff

      private void popOff()
      Pops off the score board pop up screen by itself once user clicked any button to do further operation.
